intro: Borreria rubricaulis, commonly known as the red-stemmed borreria, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Borreria rubricaulis is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
